answers.answer: Sorry Rob I have never heard of anything like this before..I eat a piece of bread and I'm stuffed..i wish I could eat more!! LOL.Do you enjoy eating??If all medical conditions have been ruled out...relax and enjoy it...and have a second helping for me.All the best to you- Melody
Eat healthy food if you have to eatl alot. That way you'll stay healthy. You should also exercise regularly. I agree with Meloday. Enjoy!

question: I am a 20 year old college student. I am 6'1.5" and 175 pounds.  My problem is that I have an abnormally large appetite.  This is not new, my mother first noticed it when I was 11. My great grandfather had a reputation for a very large appetite and she though I might have some gene from him which was causing this.  During High School I was checked for hyperthyroidism and diabetes etc., but they never found a cause.  They even took a stool sample to see if I was digesting my food correctly.  They told me my appetite may decrease when I got older.  I has a little.  I probably ate the most in 9th or 10th grade, but I have been the same for at least two years.  I think I eat 2x to 3x what most of my friends do.  I don't have any other medical problems and when I am at home and I can eat what I want, everything is fine.  At college, I am alway getting hungry at funny times.  I eat in the dorms and always go back for seconds at least.  Even then I often get hungry in the afternoon and almost always at night.  Many people comment about my appetite and seem to think it is really, really large.  Sometimes I am even embarressed to tell people when I am hungry because they will think it is so strange.  I would like to know if anyone else has had an experience like this.  I would like to know about any causes for a large appetite, and I am especially interested to know if someone has heard of a genetic cause.  Also I would like to know if there is a way to control it.ThanksRob
title: very large appetite
